SQLFunctionSpec.Name: USR_UFN_SAMECHILD_MULTICOMMITMENTS_RG
SQLFunctionSpec.Description: Finds same child in multiple commitments and does not share one revenue ID
SQLFunctionSpec.Author: Memphis Sellers
SQLFunctionSpec.CreateFunctionSQL:
CREATE FUNCTION [dbo].[USR_UFN_SAMECHILD_MULTICOMMITMENTS_RG]() RETURNS @commitmentTable table ( [ChildCount] int NULL, [SPONSORLOOKUPID] nvarchar(50) NULL, [CHILDNAME] nvarchar(MAX) NULL ) WITH EXEC AS CALLER AS BEGIN ;with sameChildCommitments (SPONSORSHIPCOMMITMENTID, COMMITMENTLOOKUPID, CHILDID, SPONSORLOOKUPID, CHILDNAME) as ( select --count(soc.NAME) as ChildCount, s1.SPONSORSHIPCOMMITMENTID, sc.LOOKUPID, s1.SPONSORSHIPOPPORTUNITYID, c.lookupid, soc.name from dbo.sponsorship s1 join dbo.SPONSORSHIPCOMMITMENT sc ON sc.ID = s1.SPONSORSHIPCOMMITMENTID join dbo.constituent c on s1.constituentid = c.id join dbo.sponsorshipopportunitychild soc on soc.id = s1.SPONSORSHIPOPPORTUNITYID --join revenuesplit rs on rs.ID = s1.REVENUESPLITID --join REVENUE r on r.ID = rs.REVENUEID inner join smartfield35EFF8A4CA954D9AA9BA012A8C82C5E3 ESSD on S1.CONSTITUENTID = ESSD.ID and ESSD.VALUE >= '1/1/2009' where exists (select 1 from dbo.sponsorship s2 inner join smartfield35EFF8A4CA954D9AA9BA012A8C82C5E3 ESSD on S2.CONSTITUENTID = ESSD.ID and ESSD.VALUE >= '1/1/2009' where ((s1.sponsorshipopportunityid = s2.sponsorshipopportunityid) and (s1.constituentid = s2.constituentid)) and (s1.revenuesplitid <> s2.revenuesplitid) ) ) insert @commitmentTable select count(CHILDNAME) as ChildCount, SPONSORLOOKUPID, CHILDNAME from sameChildCommitments group by CHILDNAME, SPONSORLOOKUPID --COMMITMENTLOOKUPID, having count(CHILDNAME) > 1 order by SPONSORLOOKUPID
RETURN; END
